update.description:
If a physics engine parameter is not found in the physics engine implementation of `SetParam`, it calls `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`, which checks the parameter name against shared parameter keys such as `max_step_size` and `gravity`. New checks have been added to `ODEPhysics` and `BulletPhysics`.

I also fixed a mistake in one of my earlier PRs, which declared `bool ODEPhysics::GetParam` to private instead of public.

[Jenkins pending](build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/627/)
update.title: Call PhysicsEngine::SetParam in child physics engines

pullrequest.title: Call PhysicsEngine::SetParam in child physics engines

content.raw:
GetParam and SetParam currently have different error messages.

`GetParam`:
~~~
[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:283] Key [fake_param_name] is not supported in dart
~~~

`SetParam`:
~~~
[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:245] Parameter [fake_param_name] not found in physics enginedart
~~~

At a minimum, there should be a space between `engine` and the physics engine name in `SetParam`, though it would be nice to make the error messages similar. Not sure if the error message should say whether it is trying to `Get` or `Set` the param.
content.html:
GetParam and SetParam currently have different error messages.

GetParam:

[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:283] Key [fake_param_name] is not supported in dart

SetParam:

[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:245] Parameter [fake_param_name] not found in physics enginedart

At a minimum, there should be a space between engine and the physics engine name in SetParam, though it would be nice to make the error messages similar. Not sure if the error message should say whether it is trying to Get or Set the param.

content.raw: It's probably complaining because I didn't put the variable name declarations in the try/catch block. I thought that reducing the amount of code in the try/catch block would be better style, but I'm not too attached to that idea. Strange that it doesn't complain about `gravity`, `magneticField`, and `value`, though; is it because they aren't primitives?
content.html: It's probably complaining because I didn't put the variable name declarations in the try/catch block. I thought that reducing the amount of code in the try/catch block would be better style, but I'm not too attached to that idea. Strange that it doesn't complain about gravity, magneticField, and value, though; is it because they aren't primitives?

content.raw:
I've started using cppcheck 1.67 from a PPA made by @\_jrivero_ and it has a few complaints about variable scope. These are also checked by the [drone.io CI job](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/5415):
~~~
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:117]: (style) The scope of the variable 'maxStepSize' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:118]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeUpdateRate' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:119]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeFactor' can be reduced.
~~~

If those are too nit-picky I can tell the drone.io job to ignore them. What do you think?
content.html:
I've started using cppcheck 1.67 from a PPA made by @_jrivero_ and it has a few complaints about variable scope. These are also checked by the drone.io CI job:

[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:117]: (style) The scope of the variable 'maxStepSize' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:118]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeUpdateRate' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:119]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeFactor' can be reduced.

If those are too nit-picky I can tell the drone.io job to ignore them. What do you think?

content.raw: I think that is exactly the right thing to do. Call the DART-specific time-step function, but still call the generic physics engine SetParam so the change can propagate to the gazebo cache of the time-step.
content.html: I think that is exactly the right thing to do. Call the DART-specific time-step function, but still call the generic physics engine SetParam so the change can propagate to the gazebo cache of the time-step.

content.raw: I like the tests you've added, but I think these generic expectations can be added to [PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc#cl-122) instead of `BulletPhysics_TEST` and `ODEPhysics_TEST`. This way it would also cover simbody and dart.
content.html: I like the tests you've added, but I think these generic expectations can be added to PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc instead of BulletPhysics_TEST and ODEPhysics_TEST. This way it would also cover simbody and dart.
